My impression is that children recover a bit quicker, even accounting for less thorough testing. And less viral load to begin with also means quicker recovery.

But full-blown infection, dark rapid tests? Yeah, about two weeks.

talk.author: did:plc:zhy73wow23zh5yzqcad72nzo
talk.utter:
It's a myth that covid is mild in children. Eg new onset type 1 diabetes is more common. Increased susceptibility to other illnesses eg RSV, adenovirus, strep.
In some respects it's worse longer term as they'll be reinfected more often through their lifetime.

talk.author: did:plc:6sxfsmo6r3y5mclw4a2js65q
talk.utter:
I did NOT say it's "mild", never believed that. Had him vaccinated even before he was eligible.

All I'm saying is that the children I know never tested positive for 10 days or more. And that's only anecdotal of course.
